original: Lindgren, Åke Gustaf Arnold, stads- | läkare, Mariestad, f. 29/11/02 i Gbg av Otto L. o. Anna Christofferson. G, 31 rn. Ingrid Schmidt. Barn: Margareta f. 32, Jan 33, Ulla 38, Claes 43. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 20, mied. kand. 24 o. med. lic. 28 i Sthlm. E. o. aman. v. patol. inst. i Sthlm 26, assist :läk. v. Mariestads ’las. 28-29, tf. undiläk. där 29, assist, v. Sahlgrenska sjukh. rönt-genavd. 29-30, v. dess öronavd. 30, tf. andre und :iläk. v. Mariestads las. 30, andre und:läk. där 31-32, förste und :läk. v. Alingsås las. 32-34, tf. stadsläk. i Mariestad 35, ord. dito sed. 36, läk. v. Mariestads epldisjukh. sed. 35.
translated:
Lindgren, Åke Gustaf Arnold, city physician, Mariestad, born November 29, 1902 in Gothenburg, son of Otto L. and Anna Christofferson. Married in 1931 to Ingrid Schmidt. Children: Margareta (born 1932), Jan (born 1933), Ulla (born 1938), Claes (born 1943). 

Education: Completed high school in Gothenburg in 1920, obtained a Bachelor's degree in medicine in 1924, and a medical license in 1928 in Stockholm. Served as a junior assistant at the pathology institute in Stockholm in 1926, assisting doctor at Mariestad Hospital in 1928-1929, temporary junior doctor there in 1929, assistant at Sahlgrenska Hospital's radiology department in 1929-1930, and at its ear department in 1930. Temporary assistant junior doctor at Mariestad Hospital in 1930, junior doctor there in 1931-1932, first assistant junior doctor at Alingsås Hospital in 1932-1934, temporary city physician in Mariestad in 1935, permanent city physician since 1936, and physician at Mariestads Tuberculosis Hospital since 1935.
